sources.title: "Head Winds" (1925) starring House Peters, Patsy Ruth Miller
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems   "Head Winds" is a comedy-drama, included in our program to illustrate the work and contributions of Patsy Ruth Miller, a star of Silent Hall of Fame.  A man hesitates too long to propose to the woman he loves. In her bitter disappointment she decides to marry another man, but then strange things start happening. Directed by                     Herbert Blaché Produced by                   Universal Pictures Written by                      Edward T. Lowe Jr. Based on                         the novel Head Winds by A.M. Sinclair Wilt Starring                          House Peters, Patsy Ruth Miller, Richard Travers, Arthur Hoyt Cinematography            John Stumar Distributed by                Universal Pictures Release date                    March 29, 1925 Running time                  52 minutes Country                           United States Language                         Silent film, English intertitles Copyright Disclaimer Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976: "Allowance is made for "fair use" for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research. Fair use is a use permitted by copyright statute that might otherwise be infringing. Non-profit, educational or personal use tips the balance in favor of fair use."

metadata.Plot: Peter kidnaps Patricia to prevent her from marrying the wrong man.
metadata.Writer: Edward T. Lowe Jr., A.M. Sinclair Wilt
metadata.Actors: House Peters, Patsy Ruth Miller, Richard Travers
